FuncDef:
The emdi lpu-group command creates an EMDI board group or enters an EMDI board group.
The undo emdi lpu-group command deletes an EMDI board group.
By default, the board group named _default_ exists.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the name of a board group.
The name is a string of 1 to 31 case-sensitive characters, spaces not supported.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
As a distributed board detection solution, the EMDI detection solution requires the configuration of boards for EMDI detection. Before configuring boards for EMDI detection, run the emdi lpu-group command to create a board group and bind desired boards to the board group for EMDI detection.
Follow-up Procedure
After an EMDI board group has been created or entered, run the emdi bind slot command to bind desired boards to the board group.
Precautions
A maximum of 32 board groups are supported.
